author: rooneg
msg: Make history tracing work with multiple renames by stashing the source rev
(txn_body_move): Pass the source rev in to svn_fs_bdb__create_copy.
(txn_body_history_prev): Grab the source rev out of the copy.
(svn_fs_bdb__create_copy): Take a source rev, init source rev member of
(copy_t): Add source rev member and note that the source txn id should be
renamed since sometimes it's the dest txn id.
(svn_fs_base__dag_move): Take source rev, pass it to svn_fs_bdb__create_copy.
(is_valid_copy_skel): Deal with source rev in copy record.

author: rooneg
msg: Instead of iterating over the changes entries to figure out where a moved
node came from just stash the dest path for the copy in the copies record
(make_path_mutable): Pass a NULL dest path into svn_fs_bdb__create_copy.
(txn_body_move): Pass the dest path into svn_fs_bdb__create_copy.
(txn_body_history_prev): Use the path we've cached in the copy record,
note a problem that occurs with multiple moves of a given node.
(svn_fs_base__dag_move): Take the target path as an argument.
(svn_fs_bdb__create_copy): Take the dest path as an argument, use it
to initialize the dest path member of the copy.
(svn_fs_base__dag_copy): Pass NULL dest path into svn_fs_bdb__create_copy.
(svn_fs_base__dag_move): take target path argument, pass it on to
(is_valid_copy_skel): Look for the new dest path in move records.
(svn_fs_base__parse_copy_skel): Parse the dest path out of the skel.
(svn_fs_base__unparse_copy_skel): Add the dest path if it's there.
